question: A 49-year-old man has had marked chest pain for the last 4 hours. An EKG shows ST segment elevation. Laboratory studies show cardiac troponin of 10 ng/mL. The representative gross appearance of his disease process is depicted here. Which of the following findings is most likely to occur in this man? <image 1>
description: The image depicts a gross anatomical view of a human heart. The heart appears to have a darkened, mottled appearance with areas of discoloration, suggesting tissue damage or necrosis. The surface of the heart shows signs of congestion and potential hemorrhage, indicating a pathological process affecting the myocardium. The overall appearance suggests a significant cardiovascular event, likely related to ischemia or infarction.
